bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SABLAN:H.R. 1304.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the Constitution of the UnitedStates. Under Section 8, Congress may make laws necessary orproper for the execution of its powers.[Page H2215]

latestAction.text: Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Hearings held.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

item.fullName: Del. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

summary.text: Small Business Jobs Act Technical Corrections Act of 2011 - Amends the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 to add the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands to the list of U.S. territories and possessions eligible for Small Business Administration (SBA) grants to carry out export programs that assist certain small businesses.

bill.title: Small Business Jobs Act Technical Corrections Act of 2011

item.title: Small Business Jobs Act Technical Corrections Act of 2011
Small Business Jobs Act Technical Corrections Act of 2011
To amend the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 with respect to the State Trade and Export Promotion Grant Program, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
